name: srafldlvec
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfield), wcel(c1, cfield), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wcel(c3, clvec))
bodyPretty: ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Field ∧ c1 ∈ Field ∧ c2 ∈(SubRing ` c0))→ c3 ∈ LVec)

stmt.origin: syl3an(wcel(c0, cfield), wcel(c1, cfield), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, c0)), wcel(c3, clvec), wcel(c0, cdr), wcel(c1, cdr), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, c0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfield), wcel(c1, cfield), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wcel(c3, clvec))

⊣ (c1 ∈ Field → c1 ∈ DivRing)
⊣ (c2 ∈(SubRing ` c0)→ c2 ∈(SubRing ` c0))

⊣ c1 =(c0[|`s]c2)

comment: Given a subfield ` F ` of a field ` E ` , ` E ` may be considered as a vector space over ` F ` , which becomes the field of scalars. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-May-2023.)
